thread.title: Beyonce Is a Golden Goddess at the Grammys
thread.title_full: Beyonce Is a Golden Goddess at the Grammys

title: Beyonce Is a Golden Goddess at the Grammys
text: Beyonce at the Grammy Awards. (Gif: Imma Almourzaeva for Yahoo) More On February 1, Beyonce announced that she’s pregnant with twins , and the world rejoiced. And then, she disappeared. Until Sunday night, when she was without question the most anticipated performer at the Grammy Awards. Beyonce (Photo: Getty Images) Beyonce (Photo: Getty Images) More In her first major public appearance, Beyonce recited the lyrics from Lemonade , without walking the red carpet first. She channeled full exotic goddess in a custom gold dress by designer Peter Dundas, in his first look since leaving Roberto Cavalli last October, where he was creative director. Dundas posted an illustration of the look on his Instagram. Beyonce clutched her belly, strutted down on stage, and sat in a chair reminiscent of a throne, a crown in her hair. The stage was strewn with flowers, the dancers bowing to Beyonce. Then, she performed a passionate, ardent rendition of Sandcastles . Beyonce (Photo: Getty Images) What a mystical world away from her first pregnancy announcement. Beyonce (Getty Images) More That adorable VMAs reveal seems like it happened decades ago. Oh, that clingy Lanvin gown. The adorable, heart-warming belly pose. Yes, we’re talking about the stunning way Beyonce basically owned the MTV Video Music Awards red carpet in 2011. Read More Beyonce (Getty Images) More She followed that up with a lively performance of Love on Top , ripping open her purple sequined Dolce & Gabbana jacket after finishing the song, grinning from ear to ear, and showing the world her pregnancy. Blue Ivy would arrive the following January. She wore the world’s sweetest pink tux to the Grammys, as she sat on her dad’s lap — and isn’t that ruffled shirt a tribute to Prince? As for that red Gucci cat bag — no words, folks, no words. Big sister Blue Ivy and dad Jay Z (Photo: Getty Images) More
